course_name: Graduate Certificate in Sustainable Energy Technologies
overview:
Clean and renewable energy technologies are catalysts for the current energy transformation towards a more sustainable future. The Graduate Certificate in Sustainable Energy Technologies is an advanced program for individuals who want to be equipped with the knowledge of the latest advances in clean energy, sustainability and how policies can shape the future of the sector.

The program focuses on providing students with the latest innovations across the energy fields with a focus on technology, sources, and systems. Students develop forward-looking and specialised knowledge to become valued experts for organisations and industries leading the transition to sustainable energy.
awards: Graduate Certificate in Sustainable Energy Technologies (GradCertSustEnergy)

learning_outcomes.text: Critically appraise and apply advanced skills and knowledge relevant to sustainable energy technologies.
Analyse data and information to design appropriate independent research to solve complex sustainable energy problems.

Develop, prepare, and engage in work practices demonstrating awareness of health and safety requirements, ethical conduct, risk management, organisation, and governance or regulatory requirements in the context of sustainable energy.
Critically reflect on self and others' practices in relation to sustainable energy technology, seek and act on feedback to develop professional practice and learning.
Communicate complex ideas using various communication approaches from a variety of methods (oral, written, digital and visual) to broad audiences around sustainable energy.

admission_requirements:
Applicants must have completed a UTS recognised bachelor's degree, or an equivalent or higher qualification, or submitted other evidence of general and professional qualifications that demonstrates potential to pursue graduate studies.

The English proficiency requirement for international students or local applicants with international qualifications is: Academic IELTS: 6.5 overall with a writing score of 6.0; or TOEFL: paper based: 550-583 overall with TWE of 4.5, internet based: 79-93 overall with a writing score of 21; or AE5: Pass; or PTE: 58-64 with a writing score of 50; or C1A/C2P: 176-184 with a writing score of 169.

Eligibility for admission does not guarantee offer of a place.

; Admission requirements for Australian students (ATAR): None; Admission requirements for Chinese students (Gaokao score out of 750): None; Admission requirements for students with GCE A Levels: None; Admission requirements for Hong Kong students (HKDSE): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (AISSC): None; Admission requirements for Indian students (ISC): None; Admission requirements for students with IB or Predicted IB: None; Admission requirements for Malaysian students (STPM with 3 AL Subjects): None; Admission requirements for Singaporean students (A Level): None; Admission requirements for USA students (SAT 1): None; Admission requirements for UTS Foundation Studies students: None
career_options: Career options include energy consultant, renewable energy consultant, business development manager (energy), academia, renewable energy engineer, electrical design engineer (energy and battery), carbon capture consultant, sustainability specialist, environmental sustainable design consultant, electrical & instrumentation technician, electrical supervisor, project officer, renewable energy engineer, energy efficiency consultant, sustainable energy systems engineer, solar energy technician, wind energy analyst, energy policy analyst, sustainable energy consultant, green building engineer, energy auditor, sustainable energy researcher, biomass energy specialist, energy storage engineer, electric vehicle infrastructure planner, energy market analyst, sustainable energy educator, sustainable energy analyst, geothermal energy engineer, energy project developer.
course_structure: The course comprises a total of 24 credit points and consists of four compulsory core subjects.
